abstract: Barbara Byrd-Bennett, former chief executive of Chicago Public Schools, apologizes after pleading guilty to helping maneuver no-bid contracts worth $23 million to education firms for $2.3 million in bribes and kickbacks; prosecutors recommend she serve seven and a half years for one count of fraud.
lead_paragraph: The former chief executive of Chicago Public Schools apologized Tuesday, saying students, parents and employees deserved “much more than I gave to them.”

headline.main: Illinois: Ex-Chicago Schools Chief Pleads Guilty in Contract Scheme
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Ex-Chicago Schools Chief Pleads Guilty in Contract Scheme

snippet: The former chief executive of Chicago Public Schools apologized Tuesday, saying students, parents and employees deserved “much more than I gave to them.”
